I use to come here for lunch when my coworkers wanted ramen. Was finally able to come back here after many years of the pandemic. Some major changes include actual waiters as this used to be a seat yourself after you order place and hooks on the side and under the tables to put your bags and coats. We came here in a group of 3 at 1:30pm on a Saturday and it only took us 5 min to get seated. I got my usual Karaage with shio ramen and they taste as good as it used to be. I love the salt and dipping sauce they have for the Karaage. The main thing I love about this place is the chili. If you like spice, I recommend ordering the ramen you like (I've tried their chili ramen but still love their shio more) and asking for the chili paste (not really paste, more like crunchy chili bits). I got to come back here and my friend got to try their vegan/vegetarian ramen which she enjoyed.

Total disappointment! We ordered miso beef and miso pork ramen, taste was absolutely terrible like rotten something, both of them... Despite this we didn't complain. We paid with cash and when they brought the change they already kept 22% tips and for the rest of money asking my father to "give more change", since he doesn't speak english or understand what is going on they took EVERYTHING, I was in restroom and couldn't help it. The worst service stuff and food I ever experienced.

Good ramen. Fresh fried chicken and they both came out very fast. Smaller seating area.

Great NYC ramen find in the Tribeca area! The service was super fast, food came out quick and my ramen was delicious as well as the sake. It's quite a hole in a wall of restaurant, it's incredibly tiny (we had to sit at the small seating bar) but if you can get past that it definitely satiates your ramen craving. Only complaint was that before I got there, my Hispanic friend was waiting for me & was told to wait outside...as it's a small restaurant I understand however it was a cold day. A white female customer came in after her to wait for her fellow guests, & the waitress sat her right inside.

Kuu Ramen is pretty average. If you are in the FiDi area and are craving ramen, you can stop by. I got the pork miso ramen, I wish it had more menma. The pork could have been fresher. I got free karaage as a deal since our table got 2 ramen dishes. The chicken did not taste fried, barely any breading so there is no crunch factor. The staff are attentive and filled up our water glasses regularly and gave us new chopsticks before we asked (since ours fell on the ground).

My experience at Kuu Ramen can be described as "just fine." I came at 6:30pm on a Saturday and luckily only had to wait 10 minutes for a table for 2. It is a very small place that seems more appropriate for take-out. However, I think ramen tastes a lot better when served at a restaurant, so we decided to eat there! I ordered the Shoyu ramen with tofu instead of beef. The ramen broth and noodles didn't have much flavor, but I did appreciate that it wasn't overly salted. It came with 2 pieces of sweet, thinly sliced tofu skin. I enjoyed the tofu skin (although it did verge on being too sweet) and wish it came with more! The marinated ramen egg is always my favorite part and was well-done here too. On the other hand, while I normally love bamboo in ramen, I thought their bamboo tasted off. While I don't plan on coming back, I know they are better known for their spicy Kuu Chili Ramen, which would most likely be more flavorful.

Ramen delivery was lovely. I had the veggie, which was a great portion. Would have loved an option to add a spicy sauce (maybe I missed it though). I'd definitely order in again!
No comment
Overall food was good. Had to wait in line, small establishment, maybe seats no more than 25? They have lots of take out orders while we were eathere.

I've eaten here in a past a few times and like how easy it is to order and experience kuu ramen. The wait isn't so bad if you just show up without a reservation. I always love the spoon they give you to use. Lately I've been ordering for delivery though because I've had a cold. This is now my go to food if I'm sick. It makes me feel better in general. It's hearty, warm/hot, comforting and I know it will go well with my medicine. I always get the same ramen which is the Shoyu Ramen, it's my go to. It's not even salty! Most ramen places will make it salty so I really appreciate how this isn't salty! Favorite part is the egg
No comment

I've finally found the best ramen in NYC! It's a fairly small restaurant and doesn't look like much, but your taste buds will not be disappointed. Everything we had here was delicious. For starters, we had the homemade gyoza. SO good. We ordered a California roll as well, which was actually a hand roll, and so fresh! The crab meat was fresh and the hand roll made it easy to eat. It was really unique and delicious. For ramen, I ordered the chili ramen and my husband did pork miso. The chili ramen was seriously amazing: the broth was perfection! The menu stated they cook the broths for up to 8 hours and I'd honestly believe it. It was bursting with flavor! It was spicy, but not overly so, and the shaved chilis were a tasty addition. On top of the great meal, it was not pricey at all. This is seriously a hidden gem. Definitely check this spot out next time you're in FiDi!
Excellent ramen! I've ordered take out from here twice and I highly recommend!!! They do not disappoint!
A Small place, but serves really good meals! The waiter was also very nice and attentive.

Came here for meal pal pick up . The food I had was sukiyaki beef Don (rice bowl with strips of fatty beef) it also came with some side salad which was also very good. I wish the rice bowl had more sauce, the beef was a bit dry as well as the rice . It was crowded during lunch on a weekday. Overall a good experience, the wait was about 10-15 mins to pick up upon arrival.@nyc_food1e

My vegan ramen was delicious. The service was super great! It's a small spot so you may need to wait a bit for a table.

I can't stop coming here. I walk in and they don't even need to say anything they just hand me my pickup order. It's always ready far before it says on any pickup app because of how fast they can prepare the ramen. I always get the spicy tonkotsu. The broth is to die for and as someone who is not always a fan of pork, this... is something different. It pulls apart in the thick broth and melts on your tongue. The noodles are always just perfectly al dente and the price is very fair. Can't recommend it enough.

Fantastic tiny authentic Ramen place. I go for lunch during the work week, if they have seats - bowl is in front of you in about 3 minutes. The tonkatsu ramen is my favorite, two thick and savory slabs of gooey pork belly in a rich delicious broth. The good bowls are about $15. Worth it.
I really like Kuu when in fidi! I have only ever ordered to go, but they pack everything up nicely, and it's always so hot!
Just had dinner at Kuu Ramen, and i would definitely come back. The food was tasty and delivered quickly to our table.  The location is clean, and the service was friendly.

I was walking by this street and this Ramen place and the Thai place next door immediately caught my attention. I made a note to come back and check it out. Came with a friend on a Saturday afternoon. It's a small place but it was crowded for a Saturday-- I guess there are lots of tourists on the weekends but FiDi is usually packed on weekdays due to office workers. We shared the shoyu fries and they were soooo good. Hot, crispy salty, but not too much, just right on point. I usually eat my fries with ketchup but these needed none. I got the kuu spicy Ramen noodles and really liked it. Since I work near by, I'll be here often during lunch time.

I decided the go for a walk and eat at the first jam packed place I stumbled upon... it happened to be Kuu Ramen. I was seated promptly at the front of the restaurant with a nice outside window view. The menu was accessed via QR code. I order their house ramen with an extra egg and seaweed salad. Both the salad and ramen were delicious! I was pleasantly surprised that the salad tasted fresh, though I'm sure it wasn't house made, I still enjoyed it. The ramen was hot and spicy. My biggest complaint is that "extra egg" should just be a whole extra egg...I have to pay extra so I can get a while egg... which was the right move because if I didn't I would have gotten less than a half egg because it was cut symmetrical. However, overall.. solid place to eat at.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: This place blew me away. I ordered the Okinawa Shio ramen with a side of karaage and Choya plum wine. Everything was absolutely delicious. The broth was so flavorful and at the right temperature. The karaage chicken was succulent and crispy. The plum wine went down so smooth and it was so sweet! I absolutely recommend this place. I must return to try other menu items. Perfect place to go with friends (I did, and we all loved it). The prices are also decent, not to experience given the area.
No comment

A pretty good ramen place in FiDi. My office is now closer to Bowling Green, so I don't come by here as often for lunch, but they do have a pretty good vegetarian friendly ramen on their menu. Portions are pretty good, though prices are pretty high, but I suppose that's to be expected in FiDi. There may be more competition now, but it's otherwise a solid ramen joint in the area.

We came here on thencoldest night of the year (9 deg F) and this place hit the SPOT. I've been coming here for years and post pandemic this is one of the only spots that has maintained normal pre covid pricing!! $15-18 for a bowl of ramen feels like a steal these days. Quick seating, great service and AMAZING ramen. One my my go to neighborhood spots for sure!!!

We came in on a rainy day and it was the perfect lunch. It's small but they made room for 5 of us. We have multiple ramens, hand rolls, fried chicken and dumplings. Everything was delicious and the service was amazing.

Kuu put the work in. This location is small and there was quite a bit of a wait but I understand why. This is Japanese food done right. Flavorful, rich, and fresh ramen - my whole family left so pleased with their meal!

I did a doordash group order for this place and they prepared the food really fast, and even separated the food based off the person ordering! I got the chili ramen and I wish I got extra spicy. It did have the right amount of spice but I wanted a little more of a kick. Granted I got takeout, so the noodles were still on the harder side but after letting it sit in the broth and microwaving it a little it was perfect. Definitely recommend coming after a night of drinking as the broth helped heal my soul!
We love Ku!  If you bring a tupperware you can pack away half the soup and noodles to have later..  Large portions!  Sweet staff.  Thanks you guys!

Great place! Solid portions. Fresh. Excellent service! Will be back for sure!  2-entrees, 1-appetizer (pork gyoza) and a Sapporo draft under $50.

I stopped in here because I was craving ramen and seen it walking down the street. It's really small inside with only about 10 seats so I felt comfortable dining alone here. My order came out super fast and was so delicious! Can't wait to be in the office more so that I can stop by more often.

Cute little Ramen joint down an unsuspecting New York side street. PERFECT on a cold NY winter's night. The karaage chicken hand roll was surprisingly good but would've been even better with some cucumber or pickled radish. I asked for unagi sauce on the side which made it even tastier. The shio ramen hit the spot. Loved the egg and green onions. The cha siu pork was a bit rough and would've made the the ramen bowl 10/10 if only the pork were more tender. Cute little unassuming spot with friendly service and decent price points. Good place to go if you're cold, in the neighborhood, and in a bind.

Quaint ramen shop tucked away on John St. I was really excited to try out this spot since it's one of the only ramen places in downtown Manhattan. I came in on a Thursday evening to an empty restaurant. I ordered the Shio ramen which was insanely salty... I usually am not picky about ramen and think most ramens taste good-not-great but this one did not make the mark... sorry! The pork was somewhat tender but not juicy whatsoever. However, my friend ordered the cold noodles and said it was FANTASTIC so def try those in place of the classic ramen bowl. The service was excellent and the waitress was constantly filling up our water glasses. I'll come again to give it another shot!

Ok so let's start with the good the spicy fried dumplings were very good. The service was great as well. The ramen was ok but it was very hot and also a good portion. So the reason I say the ramen is ok; I did not think the broth was flavorful and I did not like the bean sprouts. I think it needed more flavor; I added spice and it was good but I would definitely say it was not the star of my lunch. What I would say was great were the dumplings and service. I would definitely go back and I would try their other items I liked that the food was fresh and very hot; I love my food hot. I also like they had a monthly special which was the perfect appetizer for one person.

This small restaurant had a long line to get in - even on a Tuesday night.  Now I know why...the food is fantastic.  It's fresh, fast, inexpensive, and delicious.  The ramen was sooooo good.

I was really impressed with the ramen from Kuu, especially at the price point (around $15). Appetizers were also superb--the chicken was amazing, pork bun was delicious, and fries were well-seasoned (not pictured). Personally wouldn't order the hand roll again, but only because the other dishes were so good

I love their donburi beef rice bowl. The pork belly bun appetizer is also delicious. Highly recommend this place for delicious Japanese flavors!
i live this spot yummy ramen I love the vegan option. Soo good. I come here almost everyday.
Delicious ramen!! Oh my gosh one of the best I've had! We got the kuu chili ramen, the broth was so flavorful and the right amount of spice! Nice moody ambiance as well.

pork miso ramen was super tasty!!!! the place is pretty compact and the vibes are super cozy. i had to wait a bit to get a seat but it was totally worth it! the place is clean and the food is good !! totally recommend

So glad they are still open.   Ramen is well portioned with delicious broth. I always choose the Miso.   I love the extra veges that are included.  I've been getting this to go and they separate the broth and it's still hot when I get back to my office.  Pork ands beef have been my favorite.
After waiting an hour seamless called me to let me know they cancelled my order after it was out for delivery. I'll never know if the food was good or not.   I am very hungry.

The ramen here was delicious! We found this little shop on a block in FiDi and came in. There are only a few tables and counters, but the turnover is quick and we only had to wait for a few minutes. There are dividers set up between tables, and little hooks under each seat for you to hang up your bag or coat as it's a small space. The menu is simple, and I had the Okinawa Shio ramen bowl, which was delicious! The pork slices were really tender, the noodles were cooked just right, and I loved the broth and toppings (corn, bean sprouts, and soft boiled egg).

Have a lovely chili ramen, I hd them hold back on the pork and just had chicken, only thing with that is it's ground chicken so it kind of gets lost in the soup. Still tasty. The Japanese fried chicken was also good. I'll go back.

Kuu gets brownie points for being pretty much the only Ramen place in FiDi - however, it's mediocre. The layout and decor are very cramped, even for New York. The vegetarian ramen was fine - that's about it. I'd come back if I was desperate for some and refused to leave the neighborhood but other than that, I'm not sure that Kuu should be high on anyone's priority list.

Aesthetically the food looked great, but texture wise my ramen felt like ramen from a package. It's a cute place but I wouldn't recommend it. There's plenty of other places in Midtown that are better.
Excellent Ramen. One of the best. Small hole in the wallmust visit place !  Very popular Among locals and tourists alike.

Spicy miso ramen was pretty good. It's a fairly nice place to grab a quick bite. My friend had the sushi hand roll and it was good too

Small restaurant but super quick service so you don't have to wait long at all for a table. The food is incredible and served hot and fresh. The Takoyaki is delicious and a must-try

This place was wonderful !!! We were here on our vacation in New York and it was more than I expected. The food was delicious and incredibly delicious. They need to open a place in CO! Get here, whether you go there or live there!

Super flavorful ramen! Just visited a few days ago. It is a small establishment so be prepared to wait for a bit- we had a 30 min wait and it was worth it! i ordered the spicy tonkotsu miso and the kuu chili ramen and both were 10/10. We also ordered the vegetarian ramen and that was a bit disappointing since there was no flavor to it.
Some great eats if you are craving a bowl of yummy noodles. Fast service for a very busy location. The food is full of flavor and the staff is very friendly.. recommend if you are in the area..

Stopped by Kuu for a hot bowl of ramen on a rainy NYC weekend. The place is pretty small inside but there wasn't a wait around 5PM. We tried the Tonkatsu Shio and Shoyu ramen and they were both quite good. The portion size is probably a bit bigger than your usual bowl of ramen and it even came with half an egg so value was definitely there! The broth was quite rich and creamy while the noodles were nice and chewy. I prefer a firmer noodle because the noodles did soak up some of the soup and it got a little soggy after a while. The pork belly was thick and tender with good flavor. All in all a great place to try if you're in the area!

Amazing service, our waitress was respectful and quick, very attentive, seemed to intuitively know when I needed water refilled. Aside from service, this ramen is some of the best I've tried, not too salty at all. Strongly recommend if in the area, would definitely come again.

Amazing. Small but so good and worth the wait.  Waited 20 min for a table and the deliciousness began.  The ramen was amazing. The pork buns soft and flavorful. My son ate all the dumplings and the hand roll. Came in during happy hour so had a pitcher of Sapporo for $15 and some hot sake. Definitely going back when in town.

Other than that, the food was divine and I love their selection of drinks. Shared a plate of crispy squid legs and that was a crowd favorite for sure :) Their ramen is also super flavorful and it comes with A LOT so you'll definitely be full!
Ate a couple of times here. The place is small and you really need to look for it, but the food is good. Ramen, sushi rolls were delicious.

Brilliant food. Brilliant service. Brilliant setting. We ordered the Siracha Chicken to start, spicy but extremely tasty. Followed were the house ramen and the chicken teriyaki- both outstanding- and washed down with some Japanese soda ( Calpico original). Pricing was excellent as well
The service is fantastic! The food is tasty and the place, although small, is clean and well kept. Servers are very attentive. Would definitely recommend

Some things I love about this spot and others not so much. The chili ramen is delicious and they deliver it really well. The hand rolls are too packed  with rice and too big in my opinion. I'd order the ramen and that's all from here. I got delivery via seamless.
quick service and accommodated to our family. very friendly and helpful. Miso Beef Ramen was very good

A small inconspicuous shop, but don't sleep on the food at Kuu Ramen!  The menu isn't extensive, but each item is done very well. We ordered the pork belly bun, the karaage, some hand rolls, the nori shoyu fries, and the Kuu chili ramen. Flavors were fantastic--would recommend all of them. Service was decently fast for everything except the ramen. We came at an off time and had no issue getting seated but there's usually a decent dinner rush line to watch out for.

Very homey / comfy Japanese typa setting. Food came out fast and service was great! I can imagine it would be packed during lunch time but right after work is the perfect time to go

My friends and I went to this restaurant today, and we enjoyed our time there! The guy waiter was so nice and made sure we were enjoying our food. My favorite was the Japanese fried chicken! As for the ramen, I got the tonkotsu shoyu  (salt based) and the broth was okay, but I didn't totally hate it. I recommend this place to those who are looking for a great ramen place to eat at!!

AMAZING!! Service was great and the food was authentic! One of the employees making the food was Japanese and she was very friendly and helpful when I was asking for recommendations. My bf and I ordered the miso beef ramen 10/10 and karaage 10/10. This place was seriously so good and I highly recommend.

I was first in line waiting for a seat.  When my turn came the waiter told me to wait 10 min and proceeded to give the empty seats to the two people behind me.   Extremely rude.  I have been coming here a lot but will no longer be their customer ever.

Tiny authentic joint owned by Tai but Japanese chef. Service was friendly and fast. Food came out right away. Tuna tartare with avocado was great the Kuu chili Ramen tasty. Fried chicken ok. They have a big list of sake as well. Great value.

Excellent chili ramen and fast service. The flavor was nice and there was a good assortment of ingredients included without having to add extras!  Flavor was solid and noodles were perfectly al dente niiice.

I come here all the time. It's always crowded, but they are very quick with the ordere. Usually I order take out. The Ramen is phenomenal!!!

Delicious pork gyoza made in house. We also enjoyed our tonkotsu ramen, though the chili one wasn't really spicy according to my friend. The space is small, and the seats are tight, but the wait time was acceptable as people don't linger after they finish their meals.
Great Ramen spot in FIDi!  Efficient service and delicious food.  I got the tonkatsu ramen and it was really flavorful. They also have a beer and sake menu, so great for all kinds of nights :)

Not usually a big fan of Ramen but this place changed my mind. Tried 3-4 different kinds of items in the menu so far and all of them have impressed me. The price is reasonable and the place is clean and the staff are friendly. Would be one of my frequently visited places from now on.
Absolutely amazing! A hidden gem. Everything is delicious and the service is fantastic. Best gyoza I have had in the city, and the hand rolls are amazing. Love this place.

Everything was absolutely delicious. The pork bun appetizers were the absolute best!  We ordered different ramen (beef, pork and pork spicy) and they were very flavorful.  The noodles were cooked just right and the right amount.  It had the perfect combination of flavor and zest.  Every chair was always filled. Great service too.  The restaurant is small but worth the wait!

I have been here several times and I always get ramen. Today, I tried one of Kuu's Donburi Bowls and it delivered. I ordered the Spicy Tuna Bkwl. It' is just the right portion and enough spice to kick off the week (not to mention it's the euro cup today).
Muy rico el restaurant.. precio calidad perfecto, comida rica y atención rapida.. 100% recomendado
The food is always good and the service is great.  I loved the spicy donburi.

We loved it!!! I'm always on the hunt for delicious non-pork broth ramen options and this place is amazing for that! They have vegetarian and meat options with non-pork broth, which are all incredible. We got the vegetarian, beef, and chicken ramen bowls, and everyone was more than happy with their meal! It's a cozy joint, and perfect as we get closer to the Fall!!!

The ramen was so-so. Expected a bit more. The flavor is not as bold and was just salty for my taste. Price for ramen is not bad at $14. The chicken karage was not tasty at all at 3pieces/$3... Sucks that they dont serve complimentary water. If you are looking for a quick ramen fix then this place is satisfactory but not a first-choice option.

Come here for FREE GYOZA! Go to their IG page @kuuramen and show the server the post they are promoting for this Valentine's for your free gyoza! Thanks me later! Foods are amazing! Definitely will be back in no time!
The food was good but half way through my meal I found this piece of hair. I am sure it was a mistake but it was a turn off.
Great ramen, but first place goes to the fried tongue! I'm amazed not more places have it.

So good! Exactly what I was looking for on my recent visit to NYC. The space is small and we were originally seated along the wall right inside the door on a very cold evening. Without even asking, our server moved us to a table when it opened, which I thought was very sweet. The pork dumplings are delicious, as was the miso vegetable ramen. They even have Pocky for dessert (a favorite from my childhood that I haven't outgrown). The only thing missing. . .I would have loved a glass of wine (they do have a few Japanese beers), but my hot tea was actually perfect for the weather.
Found this place by chance. And I cannot wait to come back and try another Ramen. And the pork belly bun is a must.

The food was great and it came out fast. I had a pork bun, spicy hand roll, and a bowl of ramen. No complaints! Service was efficient and friendly.

Wow I have had a lot of ramen but this has to be one of my best bowls. My wife and I stumbled upon this place walking around the financial district. Get the spicy tonkotsu miso with an extra egg - you won't regret it! Perfect amount of kick without being too overpowering. My wife got the miso veggie and liked it but I think I won best dish lol

I quite like their spicy miso one  as it gives it more of a kick. Both times I've been here it's been quite packed but I've been able to beat the rush and I simply got lucky. It's not the best ramen I've ever had, but it's honestly not bad. ~$15/16 us per bowl of ramen. Tipping is expected at night though. So adding tax and tip a bowl of ramen cost about $29cdn, so it's not that cheap... but woe is the terrible Canadian exchange rate... sigh.

Solid Ramen spot in the FiDi neighborhood. We got the chili ramen, pictured below which was excellent. Just the right level of spice, excellent flavors, perfect for a cold day. We also got the spicy salmon bowl which was alright - a bit of a small salmon to rice ratio but still tasty. I would recommend for a quick lunch or dinner or takeout if you work or live in the area!

Came here to try the ramen. Since the line at the French place around the corner was too long. But I did not regret my decision. The broth is light and good. The tartare can be better. I would come back and try their other things on their menu. Would recommend here

Ordered kuu chilli! I'm not great with spicy but this was a great medium that I still enjoyed. Waitress was very nice. This order came with a fat piece of chyasu!! It was all delicious. Even the arugula which is bitter complimented the spicy and richness of the broth.

Food is delicious.  All the ramen is great.  Affordable prices. Highly recommend.  Am a regular.

A small ramen shop frequented by the younger clientele. About 20 seats, all high stools. Plexiglass dividers on the two tables. We each had an appetizer and my wife had the ramen. I ended up going with the sesame chicken bowl and we both loved our dishes. The service was quick and pleasant.

I'm not the japanese or ramen fan, but Kuu Ramen is my excuse. I had dinner with my friend today and everything was very outstanding ; the food, the atmosphere and absolutely service! It's been such a terrific dinner!! Recommend!!

column6: This is nice ramen place that Served  great taste of soup also nice and polite service. Noodle is well made. Really like this kuu chili ramen.
Just because it had 666 reviews. The chili ramen is always my go-to. Consistently good. Rich flavors. Recommend

Those who advised against eating ramen in the summer clearly had never been to Kuu Ramen before. This ramen spot has to be one of the most authentic and best ramen spots in the city. Because it was my first time I went with the classic/most popular ramen. The noodles were firm, the broth was delicious, and the price and wait time were fine. When it comes to ramen I do not like to toss out high praises to every joint I go to, however this place deserves it. KUU RAMEN is a must hit for any ramen lover. Scratch that, a must hit for any food lover.

One of the best ramen I had in New York. The broth is rich in flavor, perfect seasoning. Will definitely come back for their Tonkotsu Shoyu Ramen!

Excellent ramen, small but easy space, and fast service.  This place is no nonsense, but they excel in delicious and soul satisfying broth and noodles.  At certain times, the broth can be borderline too salty, but it depends on when you get it.  Regardless, the spicy pork ramen is delicious.  Try the Japanese fried chicken with spicy Mayo dipping sauce!

The service and food are really good here! And it's relatively cheap in NYC!!! The miso soup is the best miso soup that I have tasted in the US. You need to try this in NYC!
It's a small place for sit in or takeout. The service was fast and the food was good. I got the Ruu chili ramen, wasn't really spicy so I added more chili.
I tried Tonkotsu Shoyu ramen and it tasted really good! I felt like I was in Japan! I especially loved their pork cha-shuu.

Came here the first night we came to NYC. Since it was pretty cold outside, and we were starving after our flight, nothing sounded better than a hot bowl of ramen. The staff were great and got us seated as fast as they could. I've never tried ramen with a chicken and fish broth, and I was blown away at how good it was. The soup was flavorful and the noodles were just right. There isn't much seating area but they made it work with the limited space they have. The staff were also great at making sure our cups of water were always refilled promptly. Had a great time here.

We came here for dinner, got the Kuu Chili noodle soup. The flavor was on point and noodle was nice consistency. I love the pork as well. The soup however was a bit salty for my taste. Otherwise a very nice little place for a quick bite on a cool night.

Very small restaurant in the financial district that does a surprising amount of takeout and has very limited seating. Our party of 2 came in for dinner here and were seated at a 6-person table and were squished between 4 other people at the table. Despite that, the ramen was alright, broth wasn't as flavourful as I had hoped. The half-egg was very good but the char siu was rather fatty. Overall a decent place if you're craving ramen in the financial district but there are better spots elsewhere.

The place is really small and there is no waiting area, so if you decide to stand there to wait for a table you'd be in everyone's way. I had tonkotsu shio ramen and crispy squid legs and they were just okay. The pork were nice and tender but the broth really lacked flavor. I've had much better ramen in several places in DC area. The crispy squid legs lacked flavor also. It came with spicy mayo for dipping, but I wish they seasoned the squid legs better instead of just relying on the flavor of the spicy mayo. I got to try my sister's spicy Salmon Don and it was actually really good. I loved that they put fish roe in it. All in all, there are much better ramen spots in NYC, there's no reason for me to come back to this one.

The service was really fast and the food was amazing! The sitting area is not big, so get ready to maybe share a table with another party.

I like this place the ramen is really really tasty. I appreciate the soft boiled egg that can be an add on. It's clean, authentic, and pretty straight forward.  It's not a dive bar, but not a full service restaurant either. You go up to the counter order, grab a number, and then sit and wait for your food to arrive.
Badass all girl kitchen! Veggie Ramen knocked my socks off.  Add the marinated egg, best dollar I've spent in a long time.
Girlfriend loves the spicy chili ramen. Wait during lunch is super long, so plan accordingly. We've stopped by for dinner a couple times and it's much quieter. Food is always great.

Great place for ramen, especially for the price. Not really sure why people are bashing the service or quality of food. I found everything to be fresh and employees nice. Relax, NYC! :)

Cute and neat little (really little) spot in the financial district! The choice is quite limited but the ramen itself is really tasty. Get also the pork belly buns which are to die for...I just have one warning about this place: they add a 18% tip automatically to your bill for some reason...

Awesome miso beef ramen! There are many choices available! I just walked in and the service was fast and people are nice.

Get Kuu Chili ramen if you like spicy and hearty soup, the pork belly buns & crispy squid legs are very good too! Will come back to try different items very soon!

Had a Shoyu ramen. Not very tasty. The chasu was hard and the broth lacked flavor and had a bit over-use of salt.
The food was really good for the exception of the "soy sauce" based ramen soup, as it was out of this world salty! I would definitely go back and order the regular ramen with toppings.
Best taste ramen in the city for me!!! And it's soo soo cheap compared to its quality!! I have it every Sunday!! Always got extra noodle. The spicy sauce is sooo good, ask for that!!

I really liked this place service was fast as soon as we walked in the door. I decided to get bubble tea which is right up the block due to the restaurant not opening until 12pm when I arrived to the restaurant at 12:03pm it was almost full. I will say to arrive prior to opening and just wait if you want a good seat as this place only seats about 20 ppl max. Food was hot and delicious, the waiter gave us great recommendations and there was very speedy service. If you come after the restaurant is full there is typically a 20-30min wait. I didn't give it 5 stars due to how tight the space was and I felt as though everyone was eating smushed against each other. They have ramen that is only available at night and weekends due to the cook time of the broth so if you want those specialty soups wait until then to go.
The Kuu chili ramen is yum!!! The place is cute and the service is quite good. With smiley face of Kuk and Ann also the fast services make the food test even better!

One of my favorite ramen place in Fidi.I always get Miso pork ramen( super yummy!) next time I will try their signature Kuu chili ramen.Service is very fast and friendly.Will come back again to try other dishes soon
Nice location, good service. The staff was very friendly and service was fast. Below average tasting food.
Great ramen fast. Shared tables. Tiny place. Delicious food. Great prices. Definitely a go to
Really cozy environment. Nice and friendly staff . The miso soup was awesome ! And so was my sesame chicken. I have to go back and try the ramen .

The Kuu chili ramen was out of this world!! Super full and rich spicy flavor to that broth and the noodles were just ok. The broth is the hero of this dish...simply amazing. Also ordered the pork bun, it was mediocre and had more fatty pork than I would like.

Very good ramen. I highly recommend the Kuu Chili, not to salty and the right amount of spice to make you sniff a bit, but not to hot for you to fan yourself down. Breeze was a please tell waitress and the interior design is fantastic.

Decent ramen place in Fidi! Great service and reasonable price.
This place is awesome! Best Ramen in downtown area. Staff is always friendly and food delicious..

Food is good but not great, it s more like a thai way of cooking ramen with fish sauce, size is decent, price is not expensive but a bit much for a ramen. Service is awkward, there is lots of room for improvement

Been looking for a good ramen spot, finally found one  Great service, really good food, nice atmosphere! Came here several times now and no let downs!

Hot day for ramen but I can't stop coming here. I got Beef sukiyaki today. It was so good. The beef was tender and juicy. I like this small ramen spot. The service was quick. I got my food so quickly everytime I came here. Ann was so nice and friendly.

OMG I found ramen spot near my house. I got Shoyu ramen. And my mom got Teriyaki chicken. My ramen taste so good. I love the broth and the pork was so juicy. Teriyaki chicken was good and the portion was reasonable. The service was on point.

Small noodle house tucked away on a side street. So small we actually walked passed it at first. My mom and I were on a search for some good spicy ramen on a rainy day in the city. We both ordered the Kuu Chili ramen, chicken broth with pork belly and ground chicken. The noodles were cooked perfectly, spice level was medium. The egg was perfect. There could have been more than a small slice of pork. I didn't find any chicken. Normally I have leftovers for later but other than a large amount of broth, the actual ramen was minimal for the price. There was a special on Soporro, very much enjoyed that. Overall, I would visit Kuu again if I was in the area.

Great food and service (the waitress is very attractive). Best fried squid leg. The pork bun is very juicy and soft bun. Enjoyed the atmosphere and chilled draft beer. Highly recommended!

I had chili ramen - which tastes like plain chili oil and has nothing really worth mentioning. 13 dollars was also too much considering the quality. The broth and chashu pork in the ramen did not match up the standard of that in an authentic ramen. I highly recommend you to avoid Kuu ramen.
Good ramen. Possibly the best in FiDi. Average prices.
This is a tiny place located about a block from WTC--they're quick at turning tables and the food is amazing! Also, super reasonably priced for NYC. The kuu chili ramen was out of this world!
Got the spicy ramen miso and it was sooo filling and satisfying! Ramen craving at 9 pm solved!
This place is has me hooked. Small inside but the food is great. Every time I've had this place I've been pleased with the service and food.

First off, if you're a ramen lover, you really have to adjust your expectations when you come here. This place is no Ramen Lab, Ippudo, Totto, or any of the other famous ramen shops in the city. But for a lunch spot in FiDi, this place really isn't so bad (especially compared to the other mediocre lunch spots in the area). I ordered the chili ramen, which had a very spicy soup, though nothing out of the ordinary. I wouldn't recommend finishing the soup unless you really don't mind drinking salty water. The pork belly was very tasty, though there were only 2 small pieces. The noodles themselves were average and reminded me of the instant-noodle-ramen type of noodles. All in all, it was a filling and quick meal. I'd only come back if I'm feeling particularly hungry though (don't want to be in a food coma for the rest of the day!).
Yummy ramen with good appetizer fried chicken. Price is good compared to other over priced ramen houses.
So tasty, and the owner is nice！I have tried a lot of ramen but this one is the best.

One evening I was craving rice around FiDi so I settled on ordering take-out from them. I had the sukiyaki beef rice bowl. Flavors are great and rice is cooked perfectly. I also ordered their seaweed salad and octopus salad. I was disappointed by both salads. Firstly, they are basically the same salad but one has added slices if octopus. Secondly, the fact that the lady at the register should have known and informed me that they are basically the same salad (I was ordering for myself). Thirdly, the described octopus salad was different than what was packaged. Regardless still decent food.

Work around FiDi and stop by this petite Ramen shop for quick lunch. I must say for lunch rush hour, Kuu Ramen service was very fast. I was having difficult time choosing which ramen I should have and the lovely waitress came over to help me with the menu. She recommended me Shoyu Ramen, which of course it would be wise for me to listen someone whose been working in the ramen shop. I'm glad I did because Shoyu Ramen was well balanced. The Shoyu base mixed in well with the chicken broth. Creamy yet not too heavy for lunch. The Kakuni pork was firm and well marinated.

I've tried all the top ramen places in the city. Kuu has been my favorite. It's nestled in a small space right off the Fulton St stop downtown fidi. If you like ramen, give this place a try - it's great. They have many different types. They have chicken bond based broth ramen and of course pork bone based. Their broth is where they really shine. The noodles complement the broth perfectly. Takowasa here is super fresh and good too and they have tasty pork belly buns using the same chashu grilled pork that is in their ramen. The grilled pork is perfect and high quality. Definitely a surprise in the area its in and you should show it some love

So is this Thai ramen? Since people here are Thai. The ramen is not Japanese. The broth taste like it's made from a premade powder and the ramen isn't fresh. Yea it's spicy but that's the only flavor. What a shame!
Delicious veggie ramen and great surroundings in NYC's Financial District. They're currently serving a limited menu which is still fully featured.
Fast service. Affordable food. Po and Kat were so helpful and friendly! It's a warm environment with great food :)

We've gone to famous ramen places in CA and this place is pretty good. We were near the WTC and wanted to eat something nearby. The place is tiny and it's in an alley way. There was a wait time when we entered the restaurant. People have to sit next to other customers which is normal in a ramen place. We do like how they gave our food pretty quickly. The Japanese chicken and the sauce that came with it were delicious! The chicken was juicy and the sauce matched it so well. I wanted to try their special so I had the Kuu Chili which was pretty spicy. The broth, noodles, and chashu were all good. They weren't super oily and we liked that. The broth for the tonkotsu was also good. We were surprised about the thickness of their chashu because usually the ones we've been to in CA had thinner ones, but we did like the juiciness of their chashu. The ramen helped in warming us because it was so cold when we went here. Their service was good and they always came to check if we had enough water. We recommend this place to anyone in the area.

Great Hole in the Wall for Ramen in NYC fidi. Ordered Shoyu pork, Miso Pork Ramen and Tonkostu.  Food was great and hit the spot. Came after 1:30pm and there where plenty of seats available. Lunch runs around $10-14.
I love their donburi here. Comes with miso soup. It's very filling and tasty. Great spot for lunch. Only downside is that the place is very tight, so you may have to wait for a seat.

I got the Kuu Chili ramen and it was amazing! Super flavorful and meet was tender. It's a small spot and was pretty busy while I was there but was totally worth the 15 minute wait.

Great place to get some Ramen! Very satisfied. Fast ramen joint that will have you feeling great. Broth is so good and the ramen is perfectly al dente. Be sure to eat in so the noodles don't get soggy.

Its small but the food is good, inexpensive and filling. I really like the atmosphere here as well. I'm pretty sure I'll stop in again very soon.

I love ramen noodle and I was curious about this place. I had a spicy pork and chicken ramen. The flavor was good but the pork belly was very thick and not easy to eat since my spoon was plastic. I've gone to plenty of ramen places and I can say I've had better but it hit the spot for lunch that day.

Ordered the Okinawa Salt with Pork - tasty broth, lots of spring onion (which I like) with arugula (which was a first for me in a ramen).  The Chashu has nice flavor but came out a little cold (the rest of the noodles was also a little cooler than I would imagine.  Came with half of an egg and plenty of ramen.  Solid fare and filling.  Very decent price for the location and portion.  I liked this place better than the Thai place next door.

My absolutely favorite restaurant! Kuu chili ramen was fantastic. I really love the broth and fried chicken was phenomenal. Excellent service!!; I highly recommend this place.

This is an OK spot. Came in for lunch and it wasn't crowded but its a small dining area.  The noodles are given to you in take out bowls even if you stay for lunch. I was super disappointed in the miso ramen because you don't get full slices of pork but you get it cut in cubes.  Not that good if its not the slice! Its almost like bacon bites .. Meh.  The soup was good and smooth... With not too overpowering flavors but that's probably the only memorable factor.  I slurped that soup all up.  The noodles was OK. There were way too many beans sprouts.   I was also super upset that there was no egg in my order.. Cry cry cry. What is thisssss???? Haha.

I don't usually write reviews but here we go...This is a great little ramen joint near Ground Zero. Unpretentiously charming and perfect for a chilly day, we thoroughly enjoyed our lunch. Kuu Ramen was our favorite meal this weekend and I appreciate them for that.

The location is pretty small. Open kitchen with limited seating. Ordered the kuu chili chili ramen but I substituted the chicken for pork. It was packed with flavor and it was just the right amount of spicy. Also had the miso eggplant. Ive had it at other restaurants but I wasn't a fan of it from Kuu Ramen. There was a lack of flavor and the eggplant skin needed to be cooked more. It kept getting stuck on my teeth which is just not attractive. We tried to order the shishito peppers but was told they no longer make that item, which was pretty disappointing. My friend had the okinawa salt ramen. She said it tasted just like salt water. I tasted it and it didnt have a lot of flavor. The staff is super friendly. Will definitely be back to try some of the other menu items.

Closer to 3.5 stars. We come here because it is close to our apartment and ramen and a pitcher of beer is a great excuse to brave a short stint outside on a freezing day. The space is small, but the service has always been great, and the food is satisfying. If your in the area and looking for a warm meal, this is the place to go.
Favorite place around here for ramen. I always get Kuu Chili and it has the perfect amount of spice and flavor.

My girlfriend and I got Miso Vegatable ramen. I might be bias because I'm not into Far East style food. But my girlfriend said" tastes like fish water". We didn't finish our food so the waitress got concerned as the reason why and she was very nice and asked if we would like to change our order and was ready to crater for our needs. She offered me a free coke if I write a good review and then made sure I gave it 5 stars. It was quite a weird experience. So update on my review I give them 3 stars for the hustle lol.

It was one of the worst places I ate at.The soup was made with low quality ingredients and smelled very unappetizing.I was on a visit to NYC and had their food as take out. I had to throw it away after a couple of bites.
Good ramen. Very flavorful. Pork belly bun was great. Customer service was what stood out. It wasn't the best. So I think if they had better customer service, I would give them a 4.

Delicious ramen!!!! I had the Kuu Chili Chili.  I would definitely come back.  The place is small but cozy and the staff is very friendly.  The portions are average and the prices are reasonable.  One odd thing about this place is that they don't have gyoza on the menu.

Quick, affordable and tasty! Eaten once, will definitely return. Service friendly and menu is simple (a positive!)

Pretty good for takeout ramen but probably not up to snuff for sit down. If you live in the area and are craving noodles, you could do worse than the chicken ramen. For the good stuff, stop being lazy and take the train to the East Village or Bassanova in Chinatown.

Not a fan. Wanted to grab a causal meal with friends in FiDi and I was disappointed at my ramen. The broth of my Tonkatsu Shoyu Ramen did not have the rich flavor of true ramen pork broths that I love. I cringe every time I walk past the store.
Maybe not the best ramen in the city, but certainly the best in the neighborhood. Can be a bit of a wait at peak hours.

My coworker recommended this spot for lunch with the blistering cold weather, and I love ordering the veggie miso ramen. Omg the spices, noodles, flavoring and this dish is plenty to eat in one setting or take to go for a Netflix and chill kind of night!

Like many downtown lunch spots, this is a busy hole-in-the-wall not really so much it's a cute, rare find, but rather it is a tiny place with surprisingly decent ramen.  If you don't mind foregoing the "authentic" ramen experience with a real bowl, I would recommend getting to-go just in case you can't find a table.  I got the Kuu Chili Chili Ramen and it was great.  The soup was savory, the noodles were chewy, and the ingredients were pretty fresh.  Soup had a nice kick to it as well.  Not bad for $11 - will be trying the rice bowls next time.
I wanted to try Ramen for my first time and kinda regret I picked this place. The place was nice and cozy but just expected more, more flavor...
I walked one hour to have ramen here and it's totally worth it. Good food and nice staff! Highly recommended!

Stop by for lunch, this place is pack during lunch hours. The lunch special has rice bowl with four diff topping choices and two types of ramen. I order pork ramen, love that they give generous portion of ramen and vege. The food comes out very quick, the broth is okay, not too salty, I don't feel thirsty after eating it, which means they don't use too much msg. This place is small, there are four long tables, two of them attach to the wall or window. if u come with small group, you will have to share table with other customers. Price is decent $10 to $12 for ramen.

A cute small ramen place in FiDi. Came here on a Saturday night and didn't have to wait at all. I had the Spicy Sapporo ramen. It was delicious and filling, however I wish it was spicier. I would definitely go back to try their other ramens.

Eaten here a few times both dined in and taken out. Small hole in the wall type of place so not a ton of seating. I've had their kuu chili ramen, miso pork ramen, and their wings. They're quick. I've eaten here more for convenience when I'm downtown and craving ramen since there aren't a ton of options there. The only thing about the kuu chili ramen is there's too much arugula imo but that's a personal preference. I'd eat here again mainly for the convenience.
I chose the miso veggie ramen. It was good to me. The staff is also very nice. The place is small so pay attention when you look for it or you might past it.
Kuu chili w pork belly ramen noodle soup killed it. Def putting this on the go to list.

I've only eaten at the restaurant itself (as opposed to take-out), and hands-down the best ramen so far.  The pork slices in the Tonkatsu are divine (great texture and occasionally deliciously burnt edges) the egg comes with a nice gooey yolk (I HATE when places hard-boil the egg), and they use the kind of ramen noodles that are crinkly and have a nice firmness.  It also helps that they have a good variety of sake in the fridge.  Try their shishito peppers with bonito flakes too as an appetizer!
