this place had such high rating i had to give it a try. the food was good but probably would have been better had i been able to eat in the resturant. it's a very small place so not a lot of seating. i had the miso pork and it was delish.
One of my favorite local places P to stay or to take away. Good service call local five and of course great food.
A great tonkotsu ramen noodle. Highly recommend. Thy also have authentic small desserts and small sakes, beers or Japanese soft drinks. A very small place so expect to share a bench but worth it!
Excellent Ramen - For those of you that love hot and spicy, the KUU Chili was excellent.  First time visit, will definitely be back!

Good lunch spot - note that lunch prices are cheaper than what's on the Yelp Menu or online ordering sites. My faves are the Okinawa Salt and Miso Ramen. Like others have said, not the best ramen ever but tasty, great texture on the noodles, good portions, quick service. Plus the cucumber salad as a side dish is tasty and reasonably priced.

Awful awful service. Their entire waiting system is flawed. We walk in with a group of four people. so we walk in and tell them that we have four people they say there's a 30 minute wait for a table for four so we agreed to that and waited outside in the cold. We watch two young men walk in the restaurant and they IMMEDIATELY seat them into OUR spot we already had our name down on a waiting list like they told us to do the table could seat 6 in total but now 3 seats were taken but we could've sat because right before the two men walked in two people already left that table giving us space for a party of four. We confronted the waitress and she failed to give an excuse and even lied to our faces telling us ' oh uh those seats are for two people parties' what kind of service is that? Lying being dishonest to your customers... highly disappointed and just walked about from the restaurant.
Best ramen and gyoza downtown!!! Yummy and delicious! Definitely recommend coming here for a casual yet scrumptious meal of noodle goodness.

Absolutely delicious. I got the beef ramen and it was a large, hearty portion. Could have used a little more beef, but there were many other things in the soup, so it worked. Good price for the size of the dish and the service was quick.

came on a sat for lunch and small line for a 2 of us, waited less than 5mins. disappointed that they didnt run lunch special pricing thru the weekend since im sure business is slower. had the sukiyaki beef bowl. the pickled veggies and salad was nice and gave contrast to the dish. the beef was not flavored well and was bland, if even seasoned at all. pics on yelp made it look deceptively good. needless to say i found myself dousing the beef with soy sauce. i wouldnt have minded a spicy mayo type sauce on the side, or even a wasabi mayo sauce to put as an extra dressing vs. plain soy sauce. also ordered a pork belly bun, which was rather pricey for one - especially when the bun isnt fluffly like ippudo and the pork belly itself was not as thick cut as totto ramen, nor as soft yet the price is just as much. slightly disappointed in the meal since we were excited to have stumbled upon a ramen place while headed to gogocurry. their service was fair, however never refilled our ice water which we had finished half way thru the meal.

Like the fried chicken here！！been here for many times. Classic. The sever here was super nice. They fill the water very one time. I always want more after  have one bowl of noodles. Don't worry they have sides

Kuu Ramen is the perfect place for lunch on a cold or rainy day. It's small so I wouldn't suggest going there with more than 2 or 3 people. The soy ramen with pork is delicious and fills you up a lot. $10 is really cheap for a lunch in the financial district so anyone should take advantage.

I didn't try the ramen, but got the sesame chicken donburi (I chose the cheapest option, hehe). Overall, I thought the crispiness of the chicken plus the sweet-but-also-savory sauce worked well with the sticky rice. The miso soup could be more flavorful but it had a hearty amount of tofu and seaweed. This place is kinda small; I was pretty lucky to find a seat. Decent, convenient place near the train station to get food!
Ordered Kuu Chili Ramen - loved the broth and noodle texture. Not a fan of the ground chicken but the pork was delicious. We really enjoyed our meal. Satisfying quick eat in FiDi.

I dine here (takeout) at least once a week, but there have been times it's been twice. I absolutely adore this place. I don't love to dine in, as it's really small and literally one block away from my own apartment, but when I have, service is quick. That said, the fact that I can take ramen to go and it's my favorite in the city has to say something. Quality surely doesn't suffer because I'm taking it out of the restaurant. The miso beef is top notch - rich broth, perfectly cooked noodles, shredded beef...heavenly. We've tried the miso pork and others, but the shredded beef in the Miso Beef is by far my favorite. The sushi here too is surprisingly delicious - fresh fish, healthy portions and a great appetizer to the ramen. I can't recommend this place enough. My only qualm - we need frequent buyer cards! PLEASE!
Really? Ugh worst ramen I've ever had.. The broth tasted like nothing, and the chashu was wayyyy overcooked.. never coming back again.
Not the best ramen. The soup is quite bland and the noodle shape is more like a HK wonton noodle.

Still looking for a good ramen place in FiDi. Got there hoping to sit and enjoy lunch and relax. Got there and ordered their Okinawa Salt TO GO. The place is TINY, They have three high top tables and a couple of counters with seats, probably 20 seats max. If you get there after 12, don't expect to eat in. Not sure why that was. Got my order quick. Got back to my office and was able to put it all together and eat it while it was still hot. Flavor was ok, had to add some hot sauce to liven it. For $10 I got two slices of pork, that's pricey even for FiDi.

It's a great spot to grab lunch in the area or if you're just passing through! Super tasty with a smaller selection of options to choose from. They have beer and sake available as well, if you need a drink on your break before heading back to work! Thanks for your service!

I absolutely love this place for the food. Delicious and fresh.  Their portions are not small and it fills me up nicely. However, the price it's too high for soup. Literally, I was paying 13 with tax and now it's 15 plus wit tax. WTF. Not cool.

My friend and I were visiting the city the day of the blizzard and NOWHERE seemed to be open. Near the point of starvation, we finally found this place on yelp and called. Miraculously, they picked up the phone and said they were open. It was a little tough to find because it's tucked away and tiny. Nevertheless, the ramen was fantastic and reasonably priced.

It was very convenient to order delivery since we were visiting New York and didn't know the area well. The ramen was very delicious! A little overpriced for the small serving...reason for the 4 stars.
Good ramen for the area but average compare to the ramen in NYC. Would come again for a quick ramen fix but craves other shops.

Decent Ramen for the $10 price.  Not mind blowing but satisfying.  Decent flavor, pleasing to the pallette. I don't understand the arugula in the Ramen bowl. Seems out of place.  They have genuine Japanese drinks.  Stick with Ramen,  avoid the rice dishes.
Thick tasteless meat, bitter veggie, clear salt less broth.

great food near Path station. We usually go for dinner here before hitting the town or sometimes on our way back to NJ. Food is great and service is decent. I recommend this place and will go back again

I came here after visiting the Louis Vuitton exhibit on Christmas Eve. I got the tuna don bowl and the sesame chicken bowl which came with a miso soup. They were both delicious. The space is small but the staff is attentive and accommodating. The price is just right, I will definitely come back.

Found this place while searching for a bite to eat after work. No frills kinda spot. This was my first time having ramen and it was pretty good. I also ordered a California hand roll which was really tasty. It met my needs at the moment.
Tokyo in New York... Amazing options including vegetarian Ramen.  I mostly take do out.
No comment
No comment
AMAZING Ramen !!!! Had to Kuu Chilli Ramen ... So good ... I just ordered it for the 2nd time in a row
No comment
Ohh the chili Ramen soup is delicious. So much so that it deserved a repeat visit the next day. Expect a busy line full of knowing customers. Small and unassuming but such a pleasant surprise.
It was snowing so we didn't feel like going too far. This was the closest ramen place to  our hotel. Ordered the veggie ramen. It was pretty salty.
Pretty good Ramen  in a busy section. The place is very small and people crowd the place.  The Ramen is good. I ordered a hand roll that taste just ok.
Great little Ramen place - had the spicy chicken Ramen which was very delicious and satisfying.

I work near this restaurant. I have been to this restaurant a lot for lunch in the previous few weeks. The ramen and don from this restaurant are both good. I like their beef don and chicken-broth ramen. It is also very affordable. Their space might be a little crowded. That's why I usually ask to-go.
Good food. Fast and fresh.  Hit this place after a visit to the 911 memeorial.  It's an easy walk but seating is limited so its teh type of place to go with just a small group.

Super friendly staffs and very attractive. Order hiyashi ramen and Cold tofu. My ramen was served cold, mix veggie, egg and pork. Their special sauce is to die for. Don't know about other ramen yet but next times.

The only reason I still give two stars is the ramen. Food here was good. However, the experience wasn't. This is the first time that my parents visit US. When we asked for hot water instead of ice water, they were told there's none. So we ordered two hot tea. The waitress never checked on us and seemed reluctant to add water when my parents asked for a refill. Even if my parents can't speak English, they can feel people's attitude. After all these, I surprisingly found the waitress highlighted 20% tip on purpose. I have never encountered this before and felt annoyed and insulted. Even though I tipped, I don't think they deserve it because my parents were pretty upset about this meal.
Ramen is decent, but don't ever order anything else on their menu. Had their sesame chicken bowl for lunch the other day and was very disappointed. Chicken was over cooked, bland, and dry.
No comment

column3: クイーンズ, クイーンズ, NY
column6: No comment

Great ramen place near Freedom towers.   Soup was flavorful, noodles were nice and firm, and the pork was really tender.  Only negative thing about this place is that it's small and seating is limited. We ended up having this to go.   I highly recommend.
Ramen was super salty. Need to definitely drink something right after eating. Good place to get your ramen fix.

Very limited seating and people line up at the door to wait for seat. However, the food isn't as great as I'd expected given the popularity. Ordered vegetarian miso ramen and the noodles were undercooked, the tomatoes and other veggies that come with the ramen didn't taste clean - there was a fishy taste to the vegetables. Service was nice though.
No comment

Appetizers and their non-ramen dishes are okay - they are nothing to rave about.  The ramen bowls are decent...totally satisfactory to my expectation for a decent quick meal downtown.  Overall, I don't think it deserves a four star.  I'd give a strong average with 3 stars.

This new japanese ramen place in the financial district  looks like a small hole in the wall, you would need to walk around and look carefully to find this jewel in the wall street area. Had the Nasu(eggplant with miso sauce) is good but missing a little bit of flavor. The Kuu Chili chili ramen the house ramen was very good the flavor was like tonkatsu broth with some sweet chili sirracha sauce. The noodle was al dente. The price is quite decent.
I really love Sesame Chicken Don. This is first time for me at here, Absolutely I will come back here again. Thank you for make my tongue dance. ^^
Must try - octopus, Japanese fried chicken and spicy ramen. Cosy find blocks from World Trade Center!!

I won't claim to be a ramen expert, but when I walk by a ramen restaurant and see the places is packed to the brim with people, I had to give it a shot. Unfortunately I had to take it to go and I was worried that it wouldn't be as good compared to eating it right in the store. To my surprise, the take out was fantastic. They put all of the ingredients in one bowl and they include the broth in a plastic container. Aesthetically, it looks fantastic when you pour the broth in and it probably looks even better when they serve it to you fresh in the restaurant. It had so much flavor and I loved the egg right on top. I will absolutely be back soon to my new favorite ramen place in the city
Love the miso pork ramen! Noodles are wavy which I love and broth is excellent! Umami!

Normally a good joint with decent food in a no-frills environment. But this last trip ensures I'll be hitting up other spots in Fidi. The waitress was rude and clearly didn't want to be there. She was so aggressive she actually ran into me and did not even apologize. The table service was unpleasant throughout. We were treated like cattle.
No comment
I ordered fried chicken for my app and I loved it. The chili pork ramen was delicious. The staffs were friendly . I definitely gonna come back.
Didn't think anyone can pull-off ramen by delivery.  They did. It was good.
Cute little place. I went by myself. Fast service. Lots of seating. Ramen was good, but nothing special. There was no wait time when I got there. It wasn't that expensive. Perfect for a quick lunch.
Nice little hole in the wall find near our hotel! Ramen was perfect and service was great!
No comment

Been here many times. Tried to give them the chance. REALLY wanted to like this place, but although the food is beautiful it really lacks in quality. Broth is missing the richness one looks for in a good ramen. Donburi bowls are also subpar. The rice is overcooked and the meat they give is barely chewable scraps or minced. If only there was a better ramen shop in the area!
No comment

Kuu is a pretty good option for ramen in the neighborhood. Nothing we had was truly remarkable, but you leave feeling satisfied and happy after a very solid meal. The space is cozy, but the service is quick and ramen was pretty good.
Good tasty food! Would love to come back again. Their Sesame Chicken Donburi bowl is my all time favorite.
Okinawa Shiyo was decent. The noodle is the more chewy type and like most ramen, the soup is rather salty. This is a small place so prepare to wait for tables.
No comment
Kuu Ramen was my first NYC ramen experience.  This place was a tiny hole in the wall with very little seating, but it was the best ramen I've ever had.
Ordered the Vegetarian Ramen for takeout. Solid cup of Ramen, nothing extraordinary, yet I believe they get it just right by keeping it simple.

Came here several times, and Kuu Ramen hasn't disappointed me yet! I always order Kuu Chili it's so good and big portions which is sometimes I can't even finish it. The service is really good. All the workers are so friendly. I highly recommended to the people who loves ramen also the place is cozy in the busy town!! So don't missed out KUU RAMEN!

Walked by early in the week and saw it had Happy Hour specials... wow! Did not dissapoint... had crispy squid, fried chicken, fresh octopus.... delicious. The saki and sapporo drafts made it a delicious combination.
Kuu is my favorite ramen restaurant.I came here for dinner. was served by kuk, she was very friendly and helpful.

We are regulars to this restaurant. The food is always top notch. I am never disappointed with anything on the menu. The prices are very reasonable. Plus, the service is really good!! Breeze is so nice!! She's an amazing server and she has great sake suggestions. It's a really welcoming place. If you haven't tried it, definitely check it out.

Have to say that this is a 3 star place pushing towards 4 stars. Very westernized, a bit watered down, but if not for the tender pork it would be a 2-3 star joint. Ordered the Kuu Chili, definitely did not need the arugula, and the broth itself was sweet, not sweet like bone marrow sweet, but sweet like candy sweet. Everything else was great, noodles were al dente and scallions and bamboo were tasty. Unfortunately, the sweet broth left an awkward after taste. If you are a Totto or Nakamura fan, this place definitely diverges from the traditional path. Great service, though a bit small inside.
No comment

This place made me fall in love with ramen. It's quaint and not pretentious by any means but a casual spot to meet a friend or grab takeout. The Kuu Chili Ramen does not disappoint. A win for the Fidi neighborhood, I always recommend to friends.
Great ramen, great beer and great prices! I had the Kum Chili, it was spicy but not too bad!  Pretty big portions so make sure you're hungry. Overall clean and cute restaurant.
Not a big fan of their ramen, especially for the price. I totally wish it was better because I had higher expectations, but it was a quick fix for dinner.
Love getting ramen here. Usually crazy busy so typically get it to go. Went for dinner once and it was a lot calmer and they even have little sushi burritos.
Kuu is one of my favorite spots to go to! It is very reasonably priced and the food is delicious!!
I had chilli ramen and it was great!! service was fast and attentive.Will definately come back here again to try something else.

Nice joint, a little cramped if you get seated at the barstool around the outside of the restaurant. I had the Shoyu Ramen, and it was good. They added corn, which seems odd, and it's the first time I've seen it. They have 2 daily specials with 10 servings only, I'll try to get there early and update my review.

So great and well priced! Love the rice bowls. Super good, super fast service! They have some great hand rolls as well, for when you want something hearty and a little bit of sushi. Definitely a great spot.
Was just ok. It was bit salty... and the corns looked like a can corn... anyways.... it was just ok

The food lived up to the rating and reviews.  The broth is carefully homemade and takes 8 hours to make and you can taste it.  We each had a different ramen and all were good and fresh.  Service was great, fast and friendly. Mochi ice cream for desert was a pleasant surprise of freshness too.

Decent ramen spot in fidi. The broth and noodles are good, but the pork size is TINY. If I am paying $13 for a bowl of soup, I would appreciate a little more meat in there. Also the water glasses are TINY, think dixie cup size. For a dish as salty as ramen, I would expect a restaraunt to serve more water (or at least bring a pitcher to the table so people can refill their glasses...not too much to ask considering water is free). They have good beer specials though.

Perfect pick. Got lucky cause we wanted ramen on a rainy chilly day. At noon on a Monday the place was packed but ordering and food was quick. Like 10 minutes total and magically two spots to sit opened up. In and out crowd. And the ramen and hand spicy tuna roll... perfect
No comment
Best Ramen eveeeeer!  Had the pork ramen and gyoza aaand the pork sandwich.  The bun for the sandwich seemed a little stale.  Go for the ramen the ramen was delish!

Went here for the second time and all i can say is that it just gets better and better. Im actually not surprised that the food and the service was outstanding the second time since the first time was just as good. I highly recommend this to anyone who's going to try!
A great addition to FIDi. Reasonably priced,fresh delicious food. Very friendly staff. Sesame chicken with rice and vegetables,highly recommended .Can't wait to try the rest on the menu.
No comment

best ramen place around! It's a small spot but there's no wait and if there is it is not long. I ordered  pork belly buns and Miso and pork belly ramen and it was phenomenal!! $11 compared to other over priced place like ipuudo etc for $20 this is the spot to be. If you work around wall st or this area, you need to come here for lunch or happy hour etc !! I will be back. The waitress were so nice too I believe her name was Lola! Thanks for your service :)
I ordered the Kuu Chili Ramen, the soup based was not as flavorful, it was a little bland.
The food here is great and gets served pretty quickly. Was greeted by Breeze who was very accommodating. Great food and great service!
this place is near financial district  been here few times due to their taste service and the food  .i beem here with or with out friends so far they all love it. would defiantly come back

The sesame chicken and teriyaki chicken rice bowls are fantastic. The rice is always fresh and they give a miso soup with every order. I end up coming here at least once a week because I find myself craving the food. It gets very packed during lunch time so getting your food may take a bit longer and it's quite cramped while you wait, but that's menial compared to the quality lunch you get. Plus, huge portions to look forward to once you get to eat. :)
First time here. Came in on Wednesay at 630 pm and it was pretty busy. Expect to wait 5-10 minutes. Delicious chili ramen. Also really enjoyed the pork buns! Very fast service once you get a seat.
Nice cozy place. Good food and nice staff. We had the Miso Beef and they gave us free ice cream. :)). I will surely come here again.

Delicious! Ordered the Okinawa salt ramen; looks beautiful, and cooked to perfection. When you get it to go, soup is in a separate container to keep the noodles nice and chewy. The eggs are cooked just right; the soups are well seasoned. I also tried some of the beef ramen; just as good as the pork! Pretty good deal for the amount of food you receive. Really quick and efficient service. Only downside is that the store itself is very small. We ordered around 1:30 pm, and had to take our food elsewhere to eat, but it was wonderful.

Was craving something spicy and savory and tried the kuu chilli ramen.. was oily and the flavors didn't do it for me, but glad I tried it once.  Always wanted to know what $13 ramen tasted like.. I'm okay with the packets, afterall..

Tasty ramen, especially for fidi. I've ordered the tonkatsu ramen to go and didn't like it but later tried the kuu chili ramen at the restaurant and it was delicious.  Ramen to go is never as good.  Noodles are thinner and not as fresh tasting as some of my favorite ramen spots (ippudo, minca, misoya), but for $12 and the convenience, I will definitely be back when a ramen craving hits.  It's a small space so not ideal for larger groups but they bring out the food fast.  Their $4 Sapporo draft during happy hour (4-7pm on weekdays and I believe all day on weekends) is icing on the cake!
No comment
Friendly service, delicious food, and affordable prices mean I will definitely be coming back!

We got in and was immediately seated. We had an awesome server named Kat, she was so kind. Ordered the Kuu Chili Ramen and enjoyed it! If you like your food spicy, this is the dish to go with. Also would 100% recommend getting the pork belly bun. It was amazing.

I had the Ku chili ramen to go. It was beautifully put together in the to go box, the broth and noodles were separate. However the broth was just room temperature. It was good and I requested spicy which it actually was! No the best I ever had, but a good quick lunch fix when you are craving ramen.
this place is tiny , but the bowls pack flavor and the prices are good!!! The service is fast and the employees are so nice and welcoming!! i will be back!!
I really like this place.  I love Ippudo, but can't always get there or don't always want to wait two hours to get seated.  Kuu makes great ramen for casual dining or takeout without the hassle.
Ramen on a cold day in downtown?  So delicious. The service was quick and they made great recommendations. And Sapporo on tap?!  Where else can you get that. We thoroughly enjoyed this place
a good spot for a ramen and rice bowls when going around the Brooklyn bridge and NYSE area :)
I think this place is great. It's small but those noodles pack a big punch. I had the Chili noodles. Not too crazy spicy but just enough.
Really good ramen! Definitely will be there again. Just waited for 10 mins. Extra topping is good!
Amazing food. Really good ramen. Mango mochi was a crowd pleaser. My go to favorite place!

Soooooo good. I got the veggie ramen. According to the signage the broth is prepared over a period of many hours (like 8? I can't remember exactly) and you can taste the effort that went into it...did I mention, sooooooo good? The only downside is the place is tiny which limits seating so if you want to eat there go a bit early.
Ramen looks great but taste ok. Good thing is they have beef ramen! Don is average. Service is really good
Food was great. Broth was good and the tuna tartar was very delicious. The staff was very on top of it and service was quick. Breeze was very friendly.

you know what, I love the okinawa ramen with arugula.....the noodles are always done right and I have to say that this place is better than the reviews. granted, the charshu pork is a slim cut, but the bowl is very enjoyable.  stop being so snobby about soup , it's a fast food, not a fine dining tasting menu, ya know?

Really underwhelming lunch option in FIDI, even more underwhelming ramen. The prices are not justified at all, this is a no table service fast casual ramen joint, there is no reason for the bowls to cost more than the 9-11$ FIDI average lunch price. The tonkotsu is 15$ with tax and pretty sure Ippudo's ramen is around that same price and the quality drop off is huge. My ramen came with cold bits of poor quality pork and pieces of canned corn (a first?) fresh from the fridge and in a lukewarm broth, the noodles had the texture of cup noodles, I understand rent is high in the area but look at other casual ramen places in NYC (totto, ivan, ippudo, ramen lab) and i'm sure their rent is really high too. the price to quality ratio is just terrible here
I've been working down town and coming here for years. They have a consistently amazing Ramen and Happy Hour!

I was just walking by the Fulton street train station in the mood to try something new.. in fact my girlfriend wanted a soda and so we just randomly strolled in here. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by two people and it felt overwhelming at first but welcoming. We sat down and took a second to assess everything since we had never been here before. The waitress gave us really good recommendations and we went with the Miso Pork(+spicy) and the Japanese fried chicken. Portion sizes were great. Food came out fast. Service was great. Sapporo on draft. Happy hour til 7. What more can I say. This place is obviously my new favorite ramen place. If you're in the neighborhood.. don't miss out!
Fastest ramen I have ever received, but still yummy. The staff is friendly and helpful. I recommend for a quick and cheap ramen fix!
No comment

The young people who work here don't know anything about seating. Here's the story. Our party of four got to the restaurant first and there weren't any spots for four only three so they told us to write down our names on the list and they told us there were going to be a thirty minute wait and we were like "ok why not". so two guys walk in  out of no where and take our spot we were like ok what the hell. because that table had TWO people already leaving and that would have left FOUR spots open. But now they seated the two guy and now there were only two spots open again. Very very disappointed with how they manage the restaurant so we ended up going to GoGo curry next door. Best decision of my life

Came here for my first ever Ramen experience. It was cold and rainy outside, and the Kuu Chili Ramen hit the spot. It was served within minutes and nice and hot. The broth was rich and flavorful. The noodles were well cooked with just a slight bite to them. I had it with just chicken instead of pork. I think the spicy ground chicken was better than the strips of chicken thigh they replaced the pork with, but still both pretty good. The egg was nice and creamy. Drawback falls in the limited space of the restaurant, but you're served pretty quickly. Overall, I'd highly recommend this place if you're in the FiDi.

Speedy, tasty, straight-forward no fuss ramen. The space itself is small, but call ahead or put in a counter order for very quick to-go. My miso pork ramen was satisfactorily delicious. The to-go ramen comes in two containers with base broth and fixings separated. A quick pour of the base into the fixings, and, voila, ramen ready. Hot. Yummy. Recommended for a quick bite or even quicker takeout. Bonus: Open on Sunday evening in what is typically a daytime M-F business area of town. Popular with students right around the corner at Pace University.
The beef ramen is my favorite. Everything I've tried there has been delicious. Staff is always friendly and sweet. This place has become my go to place for ramen
Happy to be at Kuu. Hi Breeze!!!  Can't wait to eat and drink some sake after a 4 mile run

Decent Japanese resto in the FiDi. My go to place for lunch if i'm craving for ramen. The place is kinda small, can only seat probably around 10-14 people. You can call ahead and order for pick up. I got the miso ramen. It's good. No fuss. Not too salty and the miso was rich and flavorful. Simply delicious.

I had to pour soy sauce all over the ramen..........and if there was a microwave I would have nuked it for a good 2 minutes as well.....SOY SAUCE! Yeah I know blasphemous, well Kuu Ramen is a false idol....

I was in NYC for the weekend and it was the closest ramen place to our hotel. Called and said I was coming with 7 people, they said they could accommodate us. When we arrived it was a shock to see such a small restaurant. Had to wait 20 min, which was not bad. Giving 4 stars because the food was great and they have all day happy hour.
No comment

A tiny space in the financial district, offering ramen and several other Japanese dishes. Sitting is is tall bar-like common benches - this is a place for eating, not dates, business meetings etc. I had a basic beef ramen and it was quite good. Service was very quick, and prices quite reasonable. All in all a good choice if you are in the area and hungry.
got ramen to go, was just going to have a few bites inside cause i was in a hurry, must have been 10 seats open, they told me i couldn't eat there, would take my tip back if i could, pure idiocy

Stuck in Fidi on a weekend? You'll most likely find the available options of overpriced food, too basic fast food chains, and closed stores. But this is my saviour, a bowl of perfect brothy ramen to the rescue. So good. So so good. ($14 include tax)
Good solid ramen shop with good quality noodles and taste. There were plenty of ingredients in both the miso pork ramen and the Kuu Chili. The Kuu Chili was not too spicy and had a good savory broth.

Me & my co workers were there the other night after work & we have some Ramen soup .I ordered miso veggie soup OMG was deliscious.Perfect for the cold weather..Wondering Y it was always packed of people standing & lining up jus to order ...

The Kuu chili ramen is the best ramen I've ever had in NYC ! The bowl has a lot of toppings and they all fit well. I was satisfied with a bowl. Also, fired chicken is delicious with drinking beer together.

Honestly to say, their noodle is just so so, especially the soup of the Miso Ramen taste really cheap like instant noodles. However the price is similar to Totto Ramen. If you are a Ramen lover please curb your feet...

Another good lunch spot. Their ramen is good nothing I would recommend if you need to travel. Mostly a good local bowl. The rice bowls with the spicy ground chicken is tasty. It comes with miso soup. Plenty of food for lunch without feeling hungry or having a food coma. Fast service.
Nice service. Flavorful noodles and reasonable linch prices and variety. Comes w a soup that is not bad at all. I am please and this will be my go to ramen place!
Really good spicy tuna donburi bowl; arugula was a good complement too. Good portion of food. Great service. Reasonable prices. All day happy hour on sat.
Came here with a couple of friends and we had great time. The ramen was very good. Though the place was packed, our servers were attentive!
Broth spicy and delicious. Ramen noodles, very underwhelming. Furthermore, service terrible by young lady at register. Overall, would not recommend.

Veggie Ramen was worth it, giant bowl and deli veggies! Will do again! Make sure to try and order early, the place gets packed and with a line. Seats were empty which was great, since everyone eats very fast the place is kind of efficient.

Horrible customer service and horrible delivery attitude. Order took over almost 2 hours to arrive with an initial 30 min quote time and I am under a 5 min bike ride from restaurant. Manager on phone refused to quote status of order with delivery man claiming she is not able to reach the delivery man. I also requested no butter and bean sprouts and just extra corn instead and was told extremely rudely those two things are cheaper than corn so cannot add corn. Isn't a repeat customer worth more? Very disappointed. If I could give no stars I would just for rude service.

I'm a little bit picky with my ramen, but the noodles here are so creamy and delicious! The staff was accommodating when I asked for certain things on the side. The place is cozy and on the small side but perfect for a lunch date during the weekend. It was a little busy but as soon as seating opened, they sat me and my husband down next to another couple. I just can't recommend a better place for ramen!

Great little hole in the wall ramen spot on John St. Lots of variety of ramen, including tonkotsu, pork broth, chicken broth, spicy or not, etc. Good quality ingredients and savory, rich broth. Expect tight seating but that comes with the nature of a ramen place. Non ramen dishes are also good, even their sushi rolls. Also extra points for authentic selection of Japanese casual drinks and sweets in their fridge.
My first review is this place. Small place but ramen is very tasty. The service is effective and nice. I will come back next time to try something things new at this place.
No comment

Tiny tiny place (no surprise for ny city) but the portion for an 11$ bowl of ramen was not enough. I ordered the "veggie miso ramen". It came with one piece of tofu.. That does not work for a protein element to a vegetarian meal. The taste was also just strictly all-right .. On the sweeter side for me.
Nice restaurant, small but comfortable. Great food on the menu and good service. Ramen were delicious!
Would not recommend this place at all. Had a serious stomach ache after eating their spicy ramen.

This place is a must! The service, the apps and the ramen are top notch in the city. Me and my buddies stop here all the time and are never disappointed! If you are downtown you should come here for lunch or dinner!

Ordered two ramen, one veggie and one shoyu, both had cold ingredients (meat) lack of veggies, lack of broth, the cleanliness is a B. Customer service was good however. Wouldn't come back.... Or recommend.

Kuu ramen has excellent ramen and service! It would be great to see them relocate to a bigger building, but the cozy space does not take away from the eating experience! I ordered and recommend the Tonkotsu Shoyu Ramen.
They refuse to give free tap water to customers - you have to buy a bottle. Yeah that's going to be an automatic 1 star for lack of common decency.
Awesome ramen joint definitely a place I recommend if you're looking for a quick ramen snack
It is my go to place., the quality is very consistent and always fresh., the staffs here are very nice and attentive, also knowledgable., I will keep coming back since I live in the area.

Excited to be here.  We live in the neighborhood and found this nice spot after a run.  Great drink specials and service.  BREEZE our waitress was great! AND...My Donburi Bowl was AMAZING!  I got the Sukiyaki Beef Don with extra beef!  SOOO GOOD!  Especially for a cheat meal!

This Ramen is delicious. I love the fact that is near my home in FiDi. But, it really is a hidden gem that has delicious broth. We're lucky to have Kuu in the neighborhood. I've tried their chicken wings and they're amazing too, but the all the Ramen bowls are great.

I'm writing this review from a vegetarian's perspective - the veggie ramen is a bit bland, and has a strong seeweed taste. It's not bad, but not very flavorful either. As a vegetarian, it's the only real option on the menu. I came here due to the good reviews but thought it too bland for my taste. They only provided one slab of tofu in the bowl.  My friend got the poke/donburi bowl, but felt that there was too much rice vs the amount of meat/veggies in the bowl.
Saw this is a crowded place during lunch time so I gave it a try . Lunch is very small portion and it's little pricey.
They really skimped on the chashu. The brother was otherwise OK. But c'mon, what's with the few small squares of mostly fat?
No comment
The ramen is one of the best in the city. This is a very underrated place with nice staff fast service and great food

This is my favorite ramen place in Fidi.  (There are better ramen places in other neighborhoods for sure.)  Quality and price are both very good.  Have tried both types of broth and you can't go wrong.  Basically the kind of place you would just want to go for a quick casual dinner.  The only negative is that in the winter it's a pretty small place and if it's a cold night they seem to have trouble keeping the inside temp at a comfortable level sometimes, with people coming in and out.

I can only eat one thing here but it's the best thing. :) The miso veggie veggie ramen is exactly what it sounds like. Max veggie goodness. The veggie broth is sooo good and had all my coworkers coming over to see what smelled so delicious. Then there are spinach ramen noodles, bamboo, arugula, corn, carrots, tomatoes, seaweed, some kind of mystery veggie that tasted similar to eggplant, and a big slide of yummy bean curd. It's like a ramen salad. Go forth fellow vegetarians!

im taking a training course down the street on maiden lane, and the training room is SO COLD that all i really wanted was a hot bowl of ramen. except its 95 degrees in nyc. no problem at all! i got there around 12:10 and the place was popping! the line was about 5-6, and most of the seats were taken.  they do a REALLY efficient job of taking your order (to go or eat in), assigning you a number, and you're ready to go for the nomsies! i got the kuu chili chili and added corn, a side of japanese fried chicken, and an asahi.  $27 for everything - expensive for lunch but it was a treat for moi. the ramen came out really quickly - and they delivered the chicken to me when it was done. the chicken was delicious - perfectly fried and served with salt and spicy mayo on the side to season to your liking. the portion on the ramen was great - i only ate about half the noodles. the broth wasnt bad, but probably not as flavorful as i would like it. the chicken broth is light, so it was overpowered by the chili spice. overall i would eat here again - namely for the fried chicken and maybe try a bowl :)

Went in hoping to get some really good ramen. It was okay, not a wow factor. The server was in a rush but there wasn't that many tables or even people. It is a small restaurant and it can be confusing if it is an order first or you would order at the table. I got a simple ramen and it was okay. The salt level was to high for me for the broth. The food came out really quick, and you can tell it is not made fresh. The egg was sitting out for a while and some of my items in the ramen were still cold. The broth wasn't that hot and it wasn't a lot of noodles. Personally, I rather walk a little more just to get a better quality. I don't mind paying extra for noodles and extra stuff, but what is the whole point if it's premade and going to be served cold? I might as well do it at home. And since it was salty meal for me i drank the water real quick. The server didn't refill and kinda disappeared until there was a new customer that also thought it was an order first restaurant.

I'm fairly new to ramen outside of the old poor college student grocery store variety. This place is leaps and bounds beyond that experience. My friend and I stopped in during peak lunch hours, but were able to find space at a large shared table right away. The waiter arrived promptly and was friendly. There was a slightly longer wait than we expected for the food to arrive, but it was all delicious and we felt it was well worth the wait to have the food come freshly prepared. I'm not a ramen expert, but this place seems very good to me!
This is a great restaurant! I always order chicken donburi and put the chilli-onion-garlic topping (in the restaurant with salt and peppers)... tastes heavenly!
Delicious food ! Excellent service..probably the best ramen I've had. I had spicy miso ramen

Stumbled here one cold and rainy night looking for a quick dinner after work, and found this place. Staff is warm and welcoming, and I was quickly greeted with a pretty standard menu for a ramen place, with some interesting specials. I got the Tonkotsu Shoyu Ramen - incredible pork broth and melt in your mouth pork belly makes this a must get for those future office lunches where I'm having a bad day and nothing makes me happier than a bowl of warm noodle coup.

Come here all the time. I live down the street and for not having to go very far, this place is more than satisfactory. There is better ramen in the east village, sure, but definitely 5 stars for fidi. Never tried the rice bowls but will in the future. Super quick and friendly service too.

Excellent ramen and prompt service. If you know going in that you will probably be sitting close to your neighbor, it will be a better experience for everyone. The place is very crowded, even on a weeknight. The chili ramen is excellent, moderately spicy and very flavorful. The chicken-and-fish ramen with a creamy broth is also quite good, heavy on the umami flavor. Portions are pretty large, but I usually manage to get almost to the bottom.

I got the seaweed salad and the Okinawa Salt. The seaweed salad was overdressed. I would not get that again. The okinawa salt broth was flavorful and had decent aroma. I agree with the previous reviews about the noodles being just ok. This is not a ramen destination  place. I would say this place is more in line with that you want ramen and in a bind because you work downtown.
Good ramen, fried chicken is great! Small spot but service is good. Delivery is on point
Good atmosphere, lovely clientele. Friendly wait staff. Can't wait to come back. The ramen bowls and rice bowls are simply OUTRAGEOUS here
This is great place to have a nice bowl of authentic Japanese ramen. It's got a great varieties, the price is reasonable as well.
for a $10 lunch in downtown this restaurant's quality is amazing.

This restaurant is the best fast food ramen place there is. Even though its pretty small its food stands out among the others that I have tried. I love this place and I go there on a weekly basis. I will continue to eat here until I grow old and large with food. This restaurant is a must.

Was excited to try this new shop just one block from my office based upon the reviews here and a recommendation from someone in my building.  I found the ramen just OK.  I had the Okinawa Salt Ramen.  The broth was creamy but fairly tasteless, the noodles had a good bite to them which I enjoyed, the char siu was fine but my poor egg was completely hard boiled.  Feeling sad about it but I won't be going back here.  The crispy chinese broccoli was super delicious though.

This is my second visit.  I don't know what happened to the quality of the food, but it has really gone down hill.  The ramen noodles did not have any bite to them.  They were over cooked and mushy.  The flavor of the broth was good except for the fact it was too salty.  We ordered the Kuu Chili Ramen.  The server asked us how the food was and we gave her the honest truth.  She told us they were supposed to be like that.  Really??!!!  I've eaten good ramen all over the city (Ivan, Ippudo, Totto) and in Japan.  The noodles are not supposed to be mushy like that.  Not going back!

This was to be the second time in a day I ate at Kuu. However, this was not to be. They decided to close their kitchen, even for take out, at 9:45. I really don't understand why it is so problematic to be truthful about the time they intend to close. Is it really that hard? Say 9:45 if you intend to close then. Don't make people hurry to make it in time, just to be disappointed.

Just so so.  I had the tonkotsu ramen.  The broth was OK, but Ise has much better tonkotsu, and even Zutto are better.  While the broth was acceptable, they added arugula.  I am sure "Chef Taka" thought this would be edgy, and I would guess the Pace U kids that call themselves foodies might like it. However, Tonkotsu is famous for its depth.  It is almost creamy, its so good.  Arugula is sharp and bitter.  They don't go together.

The service was great and the food was served extremely fast, and food was yummy! Especially with my picky tastes, they complied with my requests really well. Also the ramen tasted really fresh and was great for pictures. The store is really cute and you can watch the chefs make the food in front of you. The prices are great for the food and is definitely worth every penny. The Okinawa ramen and the green tea and mango mochi ice cream was delicious and are must eats!

Very good ramen and we enjoyed it very much. We had the fried chicken appetizer, which was fair. The ramen was delicious and spicy which I like and the protein portions were good. That being said, only gave 3 stars because it is a pretty small space (even for a ramen house), it's very hard to make ramen really stand out from other ramen, and I did not particularly enjoy the texture of the mochi ice cream which was a bit grainy. Would definitely go back but might not be my go-to ramen house.
Serviceable at best. Kirage was decent. Noodles need work. Didn't have the right chew and soups too salty. Get it together.

It was recommended to me for lunch from a kid from NJ and I must say what a HUGE disappointment. The noodles were not done, chicken did not taste like chicken, and no siracha sauce.  It was overpriced for lunch and not tasty at all.
The pork belly sandwich was one of yummiest things I've ever had. The sushi was very good and the service was fast and attentive.

Came here during my lunch hour because I was feeling some ramen. Small sit down place. I ordered the Okinawa Salt ramen which came out fairly quick and was pretty tasty. It definitely satisfied my ramen craving but wasn't to filling. One intresting fact was usually the ramen places are run by Japanese people but it seems the people here are Thai, Cambodian or Laos people
No comment

I tend to eat here very often. The ramen is tastes really fresh and very flavorful. I wish there was more eating space. Even though the space is really small they do their best to provide a good experience.
The ramen is at best average. Broth is slightly dull and noodles are glassy. Service is quick and place is neat.
I had the Okinawa Shio (salt) ramen. Contrary to the name it was not salty. It was delicious and satisfying, and only $11. Nothing better for a cold winters day. I will definitely go again.

Food was just spicy enough to have a lot of flavor and still get a kick. I had the lunch special Penang curry with chicken and it was yummy! Rice was cooked perfect and the apps I had were great and good portion for one. Small place but service was great and I'm leaving full and happy.

This place is one of the lesser known Ramen places in the city but I am definitely glad I gave it a go. I went on a Tuesday evening at around 7 pm and it was a 20 minute wait which I didn't mind because it is located in the Financial district so there were probably a lot of people wanting ramen for dinner after work. I was seated by the window and noticed that there is a coat hanger located near the door which was a nice touch. The place is pretty small so you don't have a ton of room but it's still a cute little place that I would eat at again. I ordered the Kuu Chili Ramen ($14) with corn ($1) that was very delicious. The ramen comes with both pork and ground chicken and the broth is flavorful but not too spicy. I also ordered the pork bao but I was definitely underwhelmed. The piece of pork was a bit small and not as juicy as I am used to. I thought with my seating that the service would be slow because we are not as conspicuous as everyone else but our waitress still came frequently to refill our water and clear our plates.
Visiting from out of town. Love this place--good service, and food. Will recommend and plan to come back one day :-)

This was my first visit and the quality of the noodles was very disappointing. The noodles were mushy and tasted like it was uncooked and you were chewing dough. The broth was overly salted. The worst was after we commented, there was no attempt to investigate but applied an automatic service charge of 18pct!
Small place with solid ramen. Nice that it's an option in an area that often closes after other businesses do. A far cry from fast food and delis being the only choice for a bite to eat.
Delicious food.  Affordable price.  Food is served very quick after order placed.  Good choice for people in rush.
So glad I found a place with decent ramen in the FiDi area. Chicken broth is quite flavorful and not too salty. Highly recommend the Kuu Chili Chili and the fried chicken!

It's the best ramen in  Downtown. And the price is not too expensive that everybody can enjoy it ;)  i always order okinawa salt and tuna tar tar every time i been there. The restaurant is small but feel cozy.  :D
No comment

First time visiting this place. Overall, not bad but wish the place can be more spacious. We ordered the squid legs, mini salmon poke bowl and spicy tuna hand roll for appetizers. I enjoyed the poke bowl the most. Then as for ramen, we ordered the Okinawa shio abc spicy kuu ramen. Tasty but the soup base was a bit salty in my opinion. Overall, great vibe and walking distant from my office which is a plus! Also, prices are fairly reasonable for the area. Will def visit again!

Yes. I wish they were on seamless for delivery but you can do pick up so you don't have to wait in the cramped space. Get the spicy Kuu Chili and also try the spicy tuna hand rolls. I've never had a bad meal here!
Amazing! Got the miso veggie, miso pork, and two hand rolls, everything was devoured. Extremely nice and helpful staff. Will definitely be coming back...oh, and awesome music.

Perfect little spot not too far off Wall Street. This small, amazing hole in the wall spot has amazing pork buns, and spicy Sapporo ramen that'll fill you to your gut! Filling enough to have me waddling back onto Wall Street! Great service. You can tell from the genuine demeanor that everyone here carries. ALSO Amazing music selection!!!!!

Just had lunch there with friends. We had a good time. The food was exotically delicious, the service was great and warm. Cozy ambiance so good to be in these cold days. Will definitely be back again!!!
Got the Okinawa salt ramen and the tuna donburi bowl. Both were fantastic! The price was around $10-12 per item, pretty standard. Check this place out!
Ramen and Soup broth were delicious. Ramen noddles tasted fresh anf staff are quick and friendly. a go to place in The area if your in the mood for some Ramen
Thank God for Kuu! This place is just what FiDi needed. I am so happy to welcome this cozy and delicious ramen spot to the neighborhood. (Try the shishito peppers!)
Bowls are where it's at. Don't get the ramen. Get the Bowls. Trust me. Especially the spicy chicken bowl. It can easily feed two.

Came in on a saturday afternoon, we had to wait for 20 minutes because the inside is pretty small. Fits about 20 people at most. I ordered sapporo ramen, it came out pretty quick. The ramen was great and full of flavors. The only complain I have is the noodles were a little on the hard side. Ive never had arugula in my ramen, so that was new to me and it wasn't bad! I also had miso soup and that was fantastic! Overall, I enjoyed and will be back if around the area.

Pretty good food! I had the seasons chicken and my friend had vegetable ramen. We both thought our dishes were tasty and filling. There was good service even though it was crowded on a Friday evening.

You know you came to a good ramen spot when an older Japanese man is eating. Got the tonkotsu shio ramen.. it was amazing! This place is pretty small, so be prepared to have a hard time getting seats if you come with a group.

I Was here for an early dinner, arrived at about 5:30 pm with a friend who recommended this spot to me. He said an awful lot of good things about these guys and I trusted his judgment, but I think h shot to high with those compliments. The dishes here lack that authenticity that you get at some other, more dedicated Chinese locales around NY, even ones that are holes in walls. The miso pork I tried was too bland for my taste, even with the spicy seasoning. It just didn't do it for me. I'd like to come back and order a more sophisticated dish some other time, but for now I think these guys aren't anything worth raving about.

Was in the area and had a craving for ramen. Decided to check this place out based on reviews. Prices are pretty good, maybe slightly below average for some dishes. I got the Shoyu Ramen, and added Chashu pork. The pork I added was way more flavorful than the pork belly that came in the dish. And the egg was really good too. The broth was pretty bland. compared to everything else. I added A LOT of chili powder. Noodles were a good texture but tasted like packaged noodles. The worst part for me was the service. Not even a lukewarm greeting. Deadpan looks when asking for recommendations. Looks of confusion when asked to add more pork. The cashier literally looked at me like I had three heads.  I also watched other people get menus and their food brought over to them which I felt was a big difference in service compared to how I was treated. I'd rather spend $14 elsewhere. You can travel two train stops into Brooklyn for WAY better ramen than this.
Savory rice bowls, tempura, sushi... For an affordable price 8-15$ per person. Happy hour 3 to 7 pm, 4$ sapporo beer!

There is hardly no service the waiter want me to give back the number receive which I putted in my bag before I get my noodle so I have to get the fuck back to my seat, open my bag, grab my wallet and get the receive and get the noodle while I head back my bag had dropped on the ground I mean what the fuck this is not god damn shake shack why do I have to show my receive and the noodle was ok
Superb. I really love the miso pork. Would love to come back and try other soups. Great service too. So satisfying!

I had the tonkotsu ramen. Service was prompt, and the ramen came out about 5 minutes after ordering, and there was plenty of seating. I've had numerous ramen in NY/NJ, and sorry to say this is on the same level as average nama-ramen stuff you can buy in J-marts. The only thing going for them is convenience/location.
First ramen experience in the city, small hole  in the wall.  Hard to find vegan ramen options in New York. Kuu has one, fairly tasty offering. Broth sort of bland. Service and timing was great.

Kuu ramen is excellent!! This place does not hesitate for me to give them 5 stars. I came here on a rainy day with my family and I ordered the Tonkotsu Shoyu Ramen which was really good. The restaurant is small but cozy. The waiter was also very friendly and social to my family and our food came out very fast within 5-10 minutes. Definitely recommend this place

Came to this ramen spot spontaneously during my day-trip to NY and wasn't disappointed at all! It's a very quaint and hip shop and the service was great, I even got my food just 2 minutes after giving the waiter my order. I would definitely recommend checking this place out!

What a great addition to the neighborhood! I came in yesterday (Sunday...in the summer) afternoon so it was quiet---first---big props to being open on a sunday. It's annoying to the residents how many places in Fidi close on weekends/ sundays. I had the spicy ramen with ground chicken and pork and it was delicious. Everyone was super nice. I will be back to try more things.
Excellent. Fresh and really tasty.  A great find with my family while visiting the 911 memorial.  All 4 different ramens we ordered were perfect.  Well run place.
Pretty decent ramen place, nothing amazing. Pretty standard price too. Couple times I've had to wave really hard to get the waitress' attention, but that's pretty much whatever.

Their ramen is so delecious, but their broth will be salty more than other ramen I had tried. But I really like their hot sauce which mad by shrimp and chili. I love this one so that's why I bought two large jar and bring it to come back home and let my family try it. You should ask them about it when you come here.

Very solid ramen place! It's tastes good, the service is very quick and the location is convenient. Nice lunch pricing too. It's not like ipuddo or the other famous ones, but it's a great lunch option with decent ramen

Wow! I came downtown for an appointment and was very pleasantly surprised to stumble into this gem in my old work 'hood. I've never had shrimp tempura feel so light and the pork ramen was sensational. Drop what you're eating FiDi and come on down!

My friend and I were here on Monday around 6 pm and seated immediately at the front bar. Fortunately, it wasn't too busy at the time, our food was really delicious and promptly severed. The appetizers are well-compatible with draft beer, we really loved it. Service was great, severs are friendly and attentive. The food price and portion are reasonable. I would recommended coming to try out this Japanese place. My friend and I are definitely coming back again soon.
good service such as kuk & ann i like both to her ,their very nice and helpful .Kuu my favorite ramen .i will come back soon.9
Delicious!  The Chinese broccoli and chicken teriyaki were very good.  I recommend for sure.
No comment
small restaurant with limited seats. fried eggplant, cold tofu, miso beef all good.
Delicious, quick and easy lunch spot for takeout.

Had the Beef Miso Ramen. It was very tasty and the service was great! The food came out very shortly after ordering. (Only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because 5 stars to me is when a place is significantly above and beyond expectation.) This place was great and met expectations. I definitely recommend when you're feeling the need for some quick ramen. Beware though, there isn't too much seating in the restaurant.

Best ramen around FIDI. Rice bowls are great as well. They have a good assortment of Japanese liquor in small to-go bottles and also fun Japanese soda. The tiny store is always crowded but the service is quick.
Nice, cheap ramen place in Fidi. Good value, especially for the area. Friendly service. Overall a great place to grab a quick dinner after work.
No comment
Very mediocre ramen. Pork meat was inedible and broth was not good at all. And at lunchtime, they only offer chicken broth, no pork broth!! Did not like this place at all.

Kuu is a small lunch spot when you need quick ramen. I went there this morning. Today is so hot so I ask them if I can get cold ramen. They did it for me. This day is too hot to eat hot ramen so I prefer cold ramen with Yuzu citrus sauce. It is so refreshing. I got food so fast. Service is fast and friendly.

stumbled across this place on my walk home from work. i love that it's in between home and work and i love the fact that FINALLY, a ramen joint! i had the tuna sushi bowl.. hmm, nothing spectacular. my boyfriend had the kuu special ramen. yum!! and spicy. i'm also in love with the japanese coffee they sell in the open fridge. though it's quite small and expensive, i have no choice buy to buy it cause i wouldnt know where to get it aside from japan. id slowly come back to try everything on the menu :)

The crew was a little rude. I'm not done but she always came over asking me if I'm done. OMG I'll tell her when I'm done ok? There are not many customers in the restaurant. I don't why she was always in a hurry

Not bad for a to-go type ramen spot. Don't expect the best ramen you've ever had but you won't be disappointed. Good enough to fulfill your craving when you don't have the time to wait in line for the best ramen spots :)

I'm a total ramen snob, lol. The tonkotsu shio here is really fantastic. The broth is very delicious and complex with many flavors and notes that surprised me! The pork was cooked perfectly as well as the noodles. The soft boiled egg was just right with a sweet finish to the soy flavor. A great find!!

I had the vegetable ramen here and it was probably one of the best I've had so far. As a vegetarian, it's hard to find ramen that has a good, flvaourful broth. Kuu has that in spades. My friend had the regular Miso ramen which she loved as well. Service was great and the prices came out pretty affordable. Definitely a go-to place for ramen in the Financial District.
if you want a quick tasty ramen you should come here shoyu and okinawa ramen was delicious ..
Fantastic place long overdue on this desolate part of John Street.  Now if we can just manage to get rid of all the terirble places in the neighborhood we can get more great locations like this.

Had the Miso Pork Ramen. Overall taste of everything was good. Good amount of noodles but when it came to the pork it was really lacking. Literally had 5 pieces of pork. Their pork is not the sliced pork, it was small cubed chunks of pork. Looked like left over scraps! Very disappointing!! They need to first change the cubed pork and start slicing it! And then give more of it. Don't mind paying the $11 but not for the amount of meat they give.

To not be a complete jerk i will start this by saying their salmon and avocado roll were Delicious. I Tried this Ramen place during my visit to New York.  Extremely disappointed. No where near as good as the Ramen I get in Los Angeles. Which is weird because the cooks are Mexicans in both restaurants. Anyways I ordered the Miso Pork Ramen. It tasted like it passed thru the colon of the pig before it was served to me. I'm tempted to say there was an earthy flavor but that would be implying the flavor was enjoyable on some level. NO. Beautiful evening spent in this restaurant. I prefer to dress casually but still enjoy great food. This place is cozy and welcoming. Efficient and gracious service. Food is savory. We had Côte de boeuf which was presented to us prior to cutting and was cooked to our liking and the fries are the best I've had in NY! The salmon with the pea purée was also appetizing. Thanks!

After just coming back from Paris (and hitting up Le Relais de L'Entrecote) I was craving steak frites. Steak Frites Bistro did not disappoint. This was probably the juiciest, most tender cut of meat I've ever had. Great addition to the neighborhood! We loved the salad we got and the cote de boeuf (which came with two sides of fries that were perfectly crisp). We also enjoyed the chocolate soufflé. Came here for early Valentine's Day dinner and restaurant week.  Steak was nicely cooked and frites were nice and crispy.  Server was very nice and the restaurant felt rustic.  Would recommend for a date night.  Overall pleasantly pleased.  Would recommend trying it.

It had been on the list to try since I had seen it was going to be opening. It is a pleasant little place, not too large, a square-longish space that extends back. I had been to the two previous incarnations prior to Steak Frites and for whatever reason, they did no work out. I was seated when I arrived. I was given the option of sitting at the bar since I was alone but preferred a table. It was just after 5p when they open, so tables were available. I was given a food and drink menu and began to look them over but I knew what I wanted. Water arrived at the table and shortly after, bread with whipped butter in a small vat. I opted to hold off on the bread until after I had my hanger steak which I subsequently ordered. This came with herb butter but there were also several other sauces you could get if you desired. The steak came with shoestring potatoes and some greens. The hanger steak arrived medium rare and was delicious. The fries came with a small vat of ketchup and mayo. The bread, which I saved for the end was great as well, fresh with two large chunks to feast on. The space is clean, well organized. The restrooms are towards the back and down the stairs. Juan was my server and was attentive and accommodating. It is slightly more expensive than other restaurants in the area but this was a steak meal so that is to be expected. I would recommend highly and will return.

Lucky are we!   This is surly to be a New York top 10 list.   I've two absolutely delicious meals in the past 24 hours, and this new gem was one of them (the other was italian). This new French Bistro has seeming just dropped out of the sky from Paris.  Hardly a choice for vegans, but delicious French onion soup - did I say delicious yet?  The country pate was fresh and tasteful.  Lovely basket of bread and whipped butter. The main event, Steak Frites - Hanger steak - just buttery tasteful select cut, charred to perfection, with shoestring fries.  The encore- a very decadent piping hot chocolate soufflé, with chocolate sauce and crème fraîche.  Over all - one of my new favorite dinners spots. Only being a month old - a few wait staff bumps to smooth out, but am hopeful they are a winner.  OH YEAH - it's just out my front door!    HNY SFNYC!

The steak was sooo delicious and the fries are thin and crispy, and comes with amazing sauce. The best part of our night was definitely our bartender, Ashley! My one & only complaint is that the recommendation for the cook on the steak was medium so that's what I did & it did come out more on the rare side, but it was still delicious nonetheless! When we come back to NYC, we will be back to this place!

LOVED THIS PLACE! Small, intimate place with amazing food! We had the hangar steak and frites! Will be back. Lives up to its name.  Excellent Steak Frites.  Escargot better than most.  A tremendous addition to French Restaurants and Steak Houses in NYC.

This restaurant put a $200 hold on my credit card for a table of 8 people for a 5PM Saturday reservation, which was odd considering we were the only seating at that hour. The food and service was mostly very good except for trying to convince us that Blue Moon beers were Pilsners and severely overcooking one of the steaks to the point of almost inedibility. The restaurant had a bad smell though like an open/blocked drain. Lastly I checked my receipt and noticed it didn't match with the tip I left. This charming cafe serves up the most beautiful and artistic Japanese toast! I rolled up just after it opened and the counter was almost full with patrons already! I was seated right away and I ordered the berry jam and cream cheese toast with a matcha yuzu honey lemonade. My drink came out first and it was lovely! It was refreshing and had a great matcha flavor but was also sweet and tart from the honey and citrus. I loved it! And because i was sitting at the counter, I was able to watch how they made my toast! It was literally watching art be made. The bread was thick and fluffy and the strawberry jam and cream cheese combination made for a delicious combo. My neighbor to the right had ordered the adorable cinnamon butter toast and my neighbor to the left had ordered the mentai mayo and those were really pretty works of art as well. I only wish i had more stomach space to try all their toasts and more of their drinks. Their dinner menu sounded so good too. I hope to return one day!! This place is so cute and the staff are all so lovely and nice!

Davelle is a quaint restaurant and great for an intimate date. The chicken Katsu curry was amazing and delicious! The plates were so unique and really added to the presentation. I would definitely go again to try the other items on the menu.

I was drawn to Davelle's aesthetic toast from my Instagram feed, but the star of the meal was definitely the uni spaghetti. The sauce is so flavorful, we were savoring every last bite. We also ordered the chicken katsu curry and it was surprisingly better than we expected. The curry has a tiny kick to it that made it so delicious. Of course, we ordered the black sesame and cream cheese toast. Aesthetic and flavor combination are both a 5/5. I was inspired to make my own matcha cream cheese toast at home afterwards. As for drinks, we got the matcha au lait with coffee jelly and black sesame latte. I liked how both of them were lightly sweetened and though I've had better black sesame lattes before, I still enjoyed this one. The space inside is quite tiny, so I wouldn't come here with a large group and you might have to wait. Would have been 5 stars if there was a bit more uni and if the toasts weren't as overpriced, but overall loved this meal!

Davelle reminds me of my favorite types of meal from Japan. Simple, flavorful, interesting, and beautiful. I enjoyed Davelle so much I returned t try the breakfast the day after my lunch. I'll be back very soon for dinner.

It's a newly opened Japanese style cafe in LES and I have already been there a couple of times! It's just lovely with a unique menu that has a sense of a classic cafe (kissaten) in Japan!!! Signature dishes for dinner are apparently oden, which ingredients ranging from vegetables to sausage and veggie tofu nuggets (ganmo) are simmered in a Japanese broth. "Davelle" comes from a word to describe "chill" in Japanese and as the name of this place shows this is certainly a place that you want to come to relax with delicious foods. As Japanese classic cafe always do, they are particular about quality coffee, and they have a special drip coffee machine from Japan and that's something that you want to try. Also, my favorite dessert is a coffee jelly, which comes with a syrup made of milk and this is the only place that you have that tasty coffee jelly in the city. They are open from early morning to late night and whenever you stop by you can have a quality time there.

Such a cool new Japanese restaurant in the LES, with cozy homey vibes and delicious food. My party of 3 was seated at the bar, which seemed like it would be a pretty tight fit but there was actually plenty of room. We ordered the 10 oden set, fried chicken, spaghetti, and potato salad. I think my favorite was the tomato in the oden set. It was such an interesting flavor and texture that I've never tried anywhere else before. The spaghetti was amazing as well-the waiter advised us to break the egg up and mix it with the noodles to get the full flavor, and it boosted the flavors so much more! Even the potato salad, which I imagined would be very simple, was delicious and so interestingly presented. For so much food, the bill was very modest at the end. This is also a Japanese-style no-tip establishment, and the waiter said the best tip for them would be for us to come back. Overall, definitely will go back!
